tagline: Turns messy data into clear insights, actionable dashboards, and the chart that changes the conversation
pros: Translates data into business decisions — leads with findings, not methodology
Dashboard design that people actually use daily — the 30-second rule
SQL mastery: cohort analysis, funnels, retention curves, window functions
Builds self-service analytics so stakeholders can answer their own repeat questions
cons: Doesn't build data pipelines, ML models, or data infrastructure
Effectiveness depends on data quality upstream — garbage in, confusion out
Deep statistical modeling and causal inference belong to the Data Scientist

model_recommendations.notes: Solid reasoning + good writing. Benefits from thinking but doesn't need max reasoning. Best cost/capability balance.
